content.question: I actively seek out experiences that provide me with immediate pleasure or satisfaction.
Winning or receiving praise makes me feel highly motivated and energized.
I feel a strong sense of excitement when I achieve something, even if it's small.
I rarely feel excited or satisfied after accomplishing a goal.
Receiving rewards or praise does not significantly affect my motivation.
I tend to focus more on avoiding failure than on seeking reward or praise.
I can easily resist temptations that could distract me from my long-term goals.
I prefer planning things out in advance rather than acting on impulse.
I tend to delay gratification in order to achieve greater rewards later
I often act on impulse without thinking about the consequences.
I find it difficult to stick to long-term commitments or routines.
I struggle to maintain focus when faced with distractions.
I enjoy solving problems in unconventional or creative ways.
I can easily adapt to new situations and unexpected changes.
I like challenging my own beliefs and perspectives.
I feel uncomfortable when I have to change my usual way of doing things.
I struggle with thinking outside the box when facing new challenges.
Once I make up my mind about something, I rarely reconsider.
I can easily pick up on subtle social cues and emotions in others.
I feel deeply affected by the moods of those around me.
I often consider how my actions will impact other people before making decisions.
I don't usually notice when someone is feeling uncomfortable or upset.
I find it difficult to empathize with people unless I have experienced the same situation myself.
Other people's emotions don't really affect me.
I enjoy taking risks and trying new things, even if they might not work out.
I often make decisions quickly, without overanalyzing potential downsides.
I feel excited rather than anxious when faced with uncertainty.
I prefer to play it safe rather than take risks, even if it means missing out.
I avoid situations where I might fail, even if they offer potential rewards.
Uncertainty makes me very uncomfortable, and I try to minimize it as much as possible.
I experience emotions very intensely, both positive and negative.
Small events can have a big impact on my mood.
I find it hard to stay calm when something upsets me.
I rarely feel strong emotions, even in significant situations.
I am usually very composed and donâ€™t let emotions influence my decisions.
I can easily detach myself from emotional situations and remain objective.
I thrive when I have a structured routine and clear expectations.
Once I form a habit, I stick to it for a long time.
I prefer familiar environments and routines over constant change.
I get bored quickly if I have to do the same thing repeatedly.
I struggle to maintain consistent habits in my daily life.
I often change my plans spontaneously, even if I originally committed to something else.
